intro: Adenocalymma fistulosum, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the fruits are pods that are inflated and often contain a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
